intro: Lepidium hirtum var. glabrescens, commonly known as the smooth wallflower, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, four-petaled flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are usually smooth and linear, while its flowers range in color from white to yellow. This variety is distinguished by its reduced hair coverage compared to the typical form of Lepidium hirtum.
